subject: Law
title: Public Domain: When IP Expires
description: One-minute skill: Public Domain: When IP Expires.

hook.text: Shakespeare's plays are free to perform. Tolkien's books are not. The difference is the public domain.

buildup.text: The public domain is the body of creative works no longer protected by IP rights. Anyone can use them freely.

discovery.text: Works enter the public domain when their copyright expires, or if the creator dedicates them to it.

twist.text: In 2024, works from 1928 entered the public domainâ€”including early Mickey Mouse. Disney couldn't stop it.

climax.text: The public domain fuels new creation. West Side Story reimagined Romeo and Juliet because Shakespeare was free to use.

punchline.text: IP rights expire so the next generation can build on the last.

quiz.question: How do works enter the public domain?
options: When copyright expires or is voluntarily given up
